sections.purpose: To heat liquids or media in flasks and beakers.
sections.scope: Applicable to general heating tasks in Microbiology.
procedure: Place the hot plate on a stable, heat-resistant bench.
Ensure the surface is clean and dry.
Place the vessel centrally on the plate.
Switch ON and set a low to moderate temperature initially.
Monitor the solution temperature with a thermometer if needed.
After use, switch OFF and allow the plate to cool fully before cleaning.
Wipe the surface with a damp cloth once cooled.
precautions: Do not use the hot plate near flammable solvents.
Avoid touching the surface while hot; label as 'HOT' after switching OFF.
Keep power cord away from the heating area.
